sentences.sContent: Tuberculosis is still common in some parts of the world .
sentences.sCn: 结核病在世界上某些地区仍很常见。

sentences.sContent: At that time China was the most powerful country in the world .
sentences.sCn: 当时中国是世界上最强大的国家。

sentences.sContent: The Taj Mahal attracts visitors from around the world .
sentences.sCn: 泰姬陵吸引了来自世界各地的游客。

sentences.sContent: Students from all over the world come to study at Oxford.
sentences.sCn: 世界各地的学生到牛津大学来求学。

sentences.sContent: Children are the same the world over .
The book has been published throughout the world .
sentences.sCn: 这本书已在世界各地出版。

sentences.sContent: There is nothing quite like it anywhere in the world .
sentences.sCn: 世界上任何地方都找不出和它类似的东西。

sentences.sContent: Europe’s relationship with the rest of the world
sentences.sCn: 欧洲和世界上其他地区的关系

sentences.sContent: I decided to take a year off to travel the world .
sentences.sCn: 我决定休息一年去周游世界。

sentences.sContent: a crime that shocked the world

synos.tran: 世界；领域；宇宙；世俗；全人类；物质生活

phrases.pCn: 世界各地；全世界；环游世界
新世界（指西半球或南、北美洲及其附近岛屿）
（否定句内）无论如何；（肯定句内）每一方面都…
世界贸易组织（产生于关贸总协定的乌拉圭谈判， 其目的是为促进多边贸易谈判和协议而成立的。）

trans.tranCn: 世界；领域；世俗；全人类；物质生活
trans.tranOther: the  planet  we live on, and all the people, cities, and countries on it
